title: Relative Pitch
description: The idea to create this podcast came to us during the quarantine of summer 2020 whenever the world seemed to be on pause. As three young music professionals at the very beginning of our career, we found ourselves continuously discussing various music topics as it related to the world around us. Topics ranging from orchestral repertoire, conducting, music education, etc. would come up in hour long Facetime calls. One day, we decided to share our discussions with the world, and Relative Pitch was born. We feel that the purpose of our podcast is to showcase the talent, leadership, and passion that we see within our field of music, and to help pave the way for much needed change in our community that will make it a more diverse, enriching, and equitable atmosphere for anyone who wants to be a part of it.

title: Full STEAM Ahead
description:
The purpose of Full STEAM Ahead is to provide a platform for individuals who are, currently pursuing, or planning to pursue a career in the fields of Science, Technology, Engineering and Math (STEM). While the discussion and promotion of STEM fields is the main focus of the show, Art plays a key role as well. The Art portion of the show discusses various manners and how it relates to STEM. Full STEAM Ahead promotes careers in the STEAM field and serves as an outlet for professionals looking for inspirational interviews.

The goal of the podcast is to uplift African Americans and people of color in the fields listed above. While tons of money each year are donated to STEAM fields by companies, celebrities, athletes, influencers, etc., the world only gets to see small clips of these interactions. On one end of the spectrum, there are several radio shows and podcasts that focus on at least one, if not all of the following: pop culture, hip-hop culture, politics, or sports. Completely opposite of this, there are podcasts and radio shows that discuss: academia, heavily technical topics, and STEM. Full STEAM Ahead aims to have a little bit of both.

Starring James aka J Linz, Allante aka LL, Brill, Diggs, Dr. Shar and Taylor D. The show consists of three segments and a main topic or interview. Segments include LITT (Lessons In The Trap), Nature Vs. Nurture and Blowing Off Some STEAM. Dive in to see what we’re all about!

He has worked with artists from every genre, Paul Oakenfold, Tommy Lee, Kid Rock, 2 Live Crew, BT, Kaskade, Bad Boy Bill, Tydi, Morgan Page, Willy Joy, X-Ecutioners, Robbie Rivera, the Crystal Method, Colette, DJ Yoda, Coolio, Ray Nitti to name a bunch.

Outside of djing, Zerocool is also an accomplished martial artist with backgrounds in Boxing, Muay Thai, Wrestling and Brazilian Jujitsu.  Training under the likes of Duke Roufus, Wanderlei Silva, Randy Couture, Carlson Gracie, Marc Montoya, and Rafael Lovato Jr.

“I just listened through when I was out walking in the Glasgow rain - this is such a fantastic episode. Claire was very open and engaging and your questions were balanced and the ones I would have probably asked too.” - profcolinclark


The Vinyl Detroit Podcast features dad and vinyl enthusiast Brian as he takes listeners through some of his favorite records. With many being somewhat obscure and others not so much, Brian digs into the origins of the artist, recording and art direction and design of the record.

The podcast will also feature long form interviews with some of the artists and labels digging deeper into their creative process, inspirations and influences and more. Brian, who is an interviewer in his professional life and a recovering musician, has the ability to connect with the artist on their level.

So sit back, relax and let's give it a spin.

title: 12 Notes
description: Music, like people, is a journey. Through time and space, reaching all four corners of the globe. Throughout history, both music and social justice have been so deeply intertwined because, ultimately, both depend on the way we feel and the way we interact with each other. title: Far Off Sounds Podcast
description:
Far Off Sounds is a webseries of documentaries about the infinite story of music on Earth. From harsh industrial noise performed for fish in an aquarium, to a heavy metal cruise ship in the Caribbean, Far Off Sounds has been filming the ways that humans use and engage with music for a decade. 

The Far Off Sounds Podcast expands on this project. The show's creators, Jacob Hurwitz-Goodman and Nick George, interview ethnomusicologists, experimental musical meme pedagogues, musicians, label artists, journalists and others in long-form conversations about music, as well as providing a behind-the-scene glimpse at the doc series' production.

title: 52 The Podcast
description:
"52 – The Podcast" with Kristian Bush and Cindy Watts celebrates the stories behind Bush's new and award-winning songs. Original episodes will be released for free every week for 52 weeks. 

Bush, half of the Grammy-winning duo Sugarland, half of the critically acclaimed Americana folk-rock duo Billy Pilgrim and a founding member of rock group Dark Water, is releasing 52 songs over the next year in honor of his 52nd birthday on March 14, 2022.  

The album project, also called "52," will come out in four volumes over the next 12-to-18 months. 

Each episode of "52 – The Podcast" will explore the relationship between one of the popular songs from Bush's back catalog and one of the new songs from "52." Bush and Watts give insight into the songwriting process, the singer/songwriter's day-to-day life, and the musical journey that took him from his hometown of Sevierville, Tenn., to Atlanta, Nashville, and around the world as part of his various bands. 

Fun fact: Bush and Watts, a CMA Award-winning country music journalist, are from the same hometown. They share poignant moments, hilarity and plenty of dad jokes as they wind their way through their middle-age in the music business experience and Bush's life of songs.

title: The Brass Ceiling
description:
Hi everyone! I’m Yael and welcome to The Brass Ceiling.

I am a trumpet player, but also a musician, and most importantly, a storyteller. I also happen to be a girl, and despite it being 2022, only 3% of trumpet players are female. Consequently, I have always had to navigate a male-dominated environment riddled with gender, age, and power dynamics… in other words I’ve dealt with a lot of crap and I’m sick of it!

The title of this podcast, The Brass Ceiling, is really just a play on the phrase "the glass ceiling"; this pun on the famous saying feels relevant as I want to bring to light the gendered struggle that female brass players experience which is preventing them from thriving in this niche, just as on a more macro level, women and most non-straight-cis-white-men have to navigate countless systems that were not built with them in mind.

I want to use this space to talk about our stories and our musical journeys, but I also want to use this platform to crowdsource and workshop ideas to make the arts more equitable. The goal is to find that sweet spot that is fun and nostalgic, but also rigorous and forward-facing. I’m hoping that by sharing our experiences, by engaging in dialogue about the systems that need changing, and by delving into music in a way that is accessible as well as palatable,  that we will in fact be shattering the Brass Ceiling, together.

title: nobuddies yet
description:
Two New York transplants now living in Nashville, Kelly & Eric are navigating the entertainment industry landscape together. 

From landing that first post-grad job and the daily grind that ensues to the importance of mental health in our everyday lives, we’ve got it all covered; or at least we think we do. And when shit gets tough and difficult situations arise, we’re ready to help you get through them. What started as a self-deprecating phrase we coined from personal frustration, nobuddies yet quickly turned into a passionate idea and concept we thought a lot of twenty-something year olds, and younger, could relate to. We know the anxiety associated with feeling like you don’t have your life all figured out. Sometimes you need a little reminder from the people around you to just relax and that it will truly all work out how it’s supposed to. Oh yeah, and it’s more fun to go through it all with some of your closest friends, or should we say, buddies.

Each month Eurobliss unearths forgotten classics and will take you for a trip down amnesia lane to remind you of a huge fistful of songs you seriously thought, and in some cases hoped, you would never ever hear again. There is always plenty of drama and lots of controversy, interesting facts and, above all, loads of laughs as your hosts guzzle prosecco and politely disagree with each other. title: If We Speak
description:
welcome, illustrious guests, to the IF WE SPEAK PODCAST! 
we are your humble guests, acclaimed astrologer Gigi (@gigisaysyes) + up and coming filmmaker Binx (@bxessiedu), ready to debut our baby to the world! 
This is going to be a space where two Gen-Z Pisces babes share our unsolicited opinions to the world, bc we feel like as Gen Zers, particularly older gen-zers we have a lot to say!! and should say it ☺️ 

We feel this podcast, for us, is going to be a space where, EHEM!! We pass the mics to OURSELVES!!! As dark-skinned black femmes, no one is saying what we are saying, thinking or doing, so we're going to do it!  🤪 but we know that there are young people out there, our age who have been winging it too and we just want to put ourselves out there and find our people! 

We’re very interesting young lasses, gorls…met at NYU, literally besties since day one. And during the pandemic, used astrocartography to manifest a move to Houston, TX to chase our dreams and create the life we deserve. 
and now we’re here, ready to share our stories of the wildest year of our lives, how we feel about hot gossip roaming the streets, or just get things off our chests.  this space is meant to be fun, joyful, BLACK, BLACK BLACK and so full of love. 

We’ve felt like very silenced individuals for so long and  think this space is going to be so important for our growth as artists and storytellers but also as people in search of connection and community particularly online—as kids that kind of grew up online but felt very left out and invisible. 

join us every week on FRIDAYS, where there will be a visual episode on YouTube and an audio episode across all streaming platforms. 

Lock in with us! You won’t regret it :)

title: RaMoNe Music Academy
description:
In this podcast, Ramone LondonDj will share with you, some interviews that he has done recently with Scarlett about electronic dance music.
Ramone LondonDj will share with you some of his best dance music songs, the story behind these songs and some tips on how to make electronic music songs.
Ramone LondonDj is a fresh Londoner DJ and an electronic music producer using Ableton Live. 
Ramone LondonDj plays as a DJ in live music events, clubs and parties around London
Ramone also has a special interest in Training, Education and Mentoring because he loves helping people to achieve their dreams.
This is why Ramone LondonDj created “RaMoNe Music Academy” in London, where he teaches how to make electronic music using Ableton Live and how to become a professional DJ.
Ramone LondonDj is planning to create live music events around London, so if you wish, you can learn how to play a DJ Controller until becoming a professional DJ at RaMoNe Music Academy. 
This could be a good opportunity for you to play as a DJ in our live music events, build up your professional network and increase your chance to become a professional and well-known DJ

title: The Music List
description: The Music List Podcast takes a recipe for entertainment- a hotly debated musical topic, three siblings who love to argue, and open mics, and then tosses them into a mixing bowl. Shake up the bowl, and fireworks happen. The goal is to take a musical question such as greatest voice in a genre, best album during a decade, or best song by a group and create a master list to answer that question. The real battle begins when the siblings have to agree on the top five. Join Heather, Ben, and Beth, as they tackle the topics, the facts, and each other to make the definitive Music Lists.

title: The Underground Treehouse
description:
Welcome to The Underground Treehouse, a podcast that discusses and reviews music of all genres! Based out of Albuquerque, New Mexico, we are a podcast that strives to bring you album reviews that are casual and easy to listen to! Each week a different host will bring a new album to the table for us to discuss and no genre is off limits! Other than country maybe, hehe. Along with the review, we also put a spotlight on a local Albuquerque beer as well as bringing our own music recommendation of the week. An occasional topic-based discussion will be posted as well, which will give our listeners a better idea of our music tastes, as well as direct interaction with us! So hit that follow button, tell ya mom and them to follow too, and join us as we review everything we find interesting! New episodes every Friday! 
Give us a follow on Instagram @TheUndergroundTreehousePod

title: The Around the Ladder Podcast
description:
Welcome to the "Around the Ladder" podcast, the official podcast of the University of Tennessee Pride of the Southland Marching Band. "Around the Ladder" is a collaboration of the UT Knoxville Advancement Office, the UT Band Alumni Council, and the Pride of the Southland. The podcast is hosted by UTK Alum and former trumpet player for the Pride, Ronnie Boling. Ronnie is joined by co-host Brian Hardy, Director of Campus Wide Advancement at the University of Tennessee, Knoxville.
"Around the Ladder"  hopes to spark memories of past members while giving all UT alumni and fans an insiders perspective of the rich history and tradition of the Pride of the Southland as well as insight on the current edition of the Pride.

title: Hughshows Live at Just-Records
description:
HughShows and Just-Records are joining forces once again to bring independent live music to listeners in Pittsburgh, Southwest Pennsylvania, and beyond. Having collaborated since 2016 on the popular HughShowsTV series, Hugh and Dan are bringing that formula to their new podcast each month with a different musical guest who will perform three of their original songs live and chat with Hugh about their music, their interests and their role in the burgeoning local Pittsburgh music community. Professionally recorded, mixed and mastered at Dan's home studio Just-Records in Dormont, PA, the podcast promises to continue to introduce a variety of artists to lovers of live music.
Your support is so appreciated and we cannot thank you enough for tuning in and spreading the word about this exciting new chapter in our ongoing quest to #SupportPGHMusic

Sincerely,
Hugh and Dan

Kocsmai verekedések szítói. Zenekedvelők elkedvetlenítői. Pöppet sem népszerű vélemények hű szolgái. Ők a hírhedtnek is maximum csak csúfolható Cselszövők. 

Pogonyi Mór, Hollósi Dominik és Bíró Kristóf több éves közös zenei munkája nem hogy felejthető, de még csak fel sem fedezhető. Emiatt tökéletesen túlképzettek akármilyen zenekritikai munkakörhöz. Mivel máshoz ugyancsak nem értenek, kénytelenek voltak hát egy nyomaiban zenei témákat is tartalmazó műsort készíteni, amiben három mentálisan instabil egyén próbálja meggyőzni a világot a saját szubjektív véleményük alapján objektívnek gondolt tényeikről.

Ha te is végtelenül érdektelennek és kifejezetten visszataszítónak találod a fentebb említettek, nyugodj meg, nem vagy egyedül…

title: Six String Hayride
description: Welcome to Six String Hayride, a journey through the world of classic country music. Each episode is hosted by Chris Wainscott and Jim O’ Malley. Join us in the cart as we ride through topics such as murder, prison, mama, your favorite artists, the songs they gave us, and the stories that made them. Each episode will focus on a unique topic, presented in an interesting and informative way. Think of it as history meets yarn spinning. Season One will feature discussions on topics as wide-ranging as murder ballads, what is wrong with Rolling Stone’s Top 20 Country Album list, Western music, artists of color, and why Delia shouldn’t be gone. Whether you’re a diehard country music fan, a casual fan, or someone who isn’t yet aware that you like country, we’ll have something to entertain you, as well as educate you. Each episode will contain a featured recipe straight from the kitchen of those who gave us this music. Join us on our Facebook page for discussions, the recipes, songs, and more. So come along for the ride and let’s get cooking. Follow us on Facebook at Six String Hayride. Contact Us at Sixstringhayride@yahoo.com. Six String Hayride is Researched, Written, and Narrated by Chris Wainscott and Jim O'Malley. Script Editor and Business Manager, Chris Wainscott. Audio Recording and Production, Jim O'Malley. Inspiration from Heidi Kehler, Johnny, and Willie

title: Lifetimes of Listening
description:
Lifetimes of Listening seeks out and examines musical memories from people of all walks of life by conducting focused one-on-one interviews. The podcast is a conversation between hosts Dan and Brian and guests whose experience provides insight into how the collected stories reflect why music becomes central to so many people’s lives. Dan Kruse is a documentarian, percussionist, and an ethnomusicologist. Brian Moon is a choral conductor, guitarist, and musicologist. Between them, they have decades of experience working with people of all ages to help understand and value the many connections that people have to music. Lifetimes of Listening, a monthly podcast, will entertain, educate, and affirm why music is so important to you. 

Learn more and participate at: 
https://musicalmemories.music.arizona.edu/

title: Sounds of the Diaspora

title: Cloud Machine
description:
Cloud Machine is a weekly music business video podcast hosted by Mat Landry and industry insiders. In weekly episodes, he and his guests have informative discussions about music, its modern realities, and common practices that are so often kept behind closed doors. They discuss current themes that affect today's music landscape and how to navigate through them as a fan, musician, or business professional.

This podcast aims to educate viewers and listeners on what they want and need to know about the music industry, including label/organizational structure & negotiation, distribution & modern streaming practices, and the live performance sector. Cloud Machine does so by interviewing knowledgeable music business professionals, by pulling down your favourite artists' backstage curtain, and by staying up to date on innovative topics.

Find our video podcasts on the Eights Creative Youtube channel!

title: The Sound Around Us!
description:
"Sound Around Us" is a podcast that explores the various sounds in our environment and the impact they have on our daily lives. From the chirping of birds in a park to the hum of traffic on a busy street, the podcast delves into "The Sound Around Us", where the pun was most definitely intended! The program includes distinctive sounds from all around the world with a focus on allowing listeners to feel new emotions just by listening. The podcast seeks to increase listeners' awareness of how important sound is in creating our environment and to inspire people to pay closer attention to the noises they are surrounded by.  

Overall, music plays a huge role in our lives! Everywhere we turn, from the contemporary world to mother nature herself, we see it. Watch this space for weekly updates!

This international podcast is for all the outcasts in this world and for everyone who enjoys talking and learning about the world's biggest and best music competition!

title: Gollden Hour Ambient Music & Wellness Podcast
description:

Each episode will feature a collection of tracks with different themes and a focus on specific ambient works, along with a background about the artist and region where they are from. As this podcast is also a wellness podcast, at the end of each episode, you can join in on a guided meditation, giving you the opportunity to find some stillness and space!

Due to music copyright, full episodes of this podcast is only available on Spotify.

***

Gollden is the ambient music project of Collette Andrea, singer-songwriter, multi-instrumentalist and producer from Toronto, Canada. Since 2018 Collette has been combining music and wellness through the art of sound healing and meditation.

Nightshift - Nashville Electronica Sessions offers an inside look at the city's thriving electronic music scene and is a must-listen for anyone interested in electronic music, Nashville, or both.

title: Khu.éex’
description:
This is a deep listening journey into the story of Khu.éex’ as told by the band’s co-founder Preston Singletary and guitarist Captain Raab. The band was formed in 2013 after a chance meeting with Bernie Worrell, keyboardist and co-founding member of Parliament-Funkadelic. Khu.éex’ is an Indigenous band that explores Jazz and Funk/Rock with an improvisational style. The fusion of these styles with spoken word in English, Tlingit, Haida and Y’upic languages is unique. Together with Skerik and Stanton Moore, Gene Tagaban and Clarissa Rizal, they recorded under the direction of Randall Dunn and created four prolific albums; The Wilderness Within, They Forgot They Survived, H​é​en, and WOOch. This five episode podcast series will tell the story of how they met, and dive deep into the musical compositions on each record.

Khu.éex’ is currently working on new music! Learn more about how you can support the band and get involved at https://igg.me/at/khueexmusic/x#/

title: Caribbean Fans
description:
Welcome to the Caribbean Fans podcast, your ultimate destination for all things Caribbean culture, music, and community. Join us as we celebrate the vibrant spirit of the Caribbean, exploring its rich traditions, diverse heritage, and the talents that make this region truly special.

Each episode, we dive deep into captivating topics that showcase the essence of Caribbean life. From insightful interviews with renowned artists and cultural icons to engaging discussions on the latest releases from talented musicians across the Caribbean, we bring you closer to the beating heart of the islands.

But this podcast is not just about us. It's about you, the incredible Caribbean Fans community. We value your voice and encourage you to be an active participant in this journey. Share your comments, stories, and suggestions as we create a space that reflects the collective passion we all have for the Caribbean.

Get ready to immerse yourself in the rhythms, melodies, and stories that define the Caribbean. Our goal is to inspire, entertain, and educate, all while fostering a sense of unity among our diverse audience.

So, whether you're a Caribbean native, a fan of the culture, or someone seeking an escape to paradise through captivating storytelling, this podcast is for you. Subscribe now and join our vibrant community of Caribbean Fans as we embark on an unforgettable journey through the colorful and soulful tapestry of the Caribbean.

Stay connected, stay inspired, and together, let's keep the Caribbean spirit alive!

description:
双人电波是一档由插画师BrolySu跟制作人好友FridayWav一起闲聊交流的嘻哈音乐分享栏目。每期我们都会挑几首喜欢的Hip-Hop来跟大家分享，目的就是为了推广更多我们觉得尖的音乐人和作品。从一起在美国留学的时期我们私下就会经常碰面做这件事，也感谢互联网的便利，能够持续让我们在不同的地方推进音乐分享。

DONN Radio is a hip-hop music-sharing column where illustrator BrolySu chats with producer friend FridayWav. In each episode, we will select a few favorite Hip-Hop songs to share with you, the purpose is to promote more musicians and works that we think are top-notch. Since we both studied at Indiana University, we have often met privately to do this. We are so grateful for the convenience of the Internet, which allows us to continue to promote music sharing in different places.

Honestly ? It will be different every week, for every episode, but, it's ideally during your alone time.

title: TATE's Version
description:
The Final Jam: Our Love Story

Hey there, it's your favorite crew of misfits—Andria, Eileen, Thej, and Tania—coming at you with our ultimate farewell podcast, "The Final Jam: Our Love Story". We're getting all sappy and nostalgic as we bid adieu to our wild ride together, and what better way to do it than through the epic anthem of Taylor Swift's "Love Story".

Get ready to dive into a whirlwind of emotions as we spill the beans, sharing hilarious stories, tearful goodbyes, and tons of inside jokes. We'll take you on a rollercoaster of memories and melodies that will have you laughing, crying, and probably shaking your head at our sheer madness.

We're not just talking about the song, folks. Nope, we're going full-on deep dive mode, connecting the dots between our lives and the infectious beats of "Love Story". Prepare for our unique takes, personal anecdotes, and the occasional disagreement on the hidden meanings in those catchy lyrics.

Join us around the virtual campfire as we pour our hearts out, reminiscing about the good, the bad, and the utterly ridiculous moments we've shared. From secret crushes to epic adventures, we'll unravel it all and let you in on the secrets of our unbreakable bond.

Expect unfiltered banter, spontaneous bursts of laughter, and maybe a few embarrassing revelations along the way. We promise to keep it real, letting our quirks shine through and reminding you that friendships are messy, but oh-so-worth it.

"The Final Jam: Our Love Story" is our love letter to each other and to the journey we've taken as a ragtag group. We're raising a glass to growth, togetherness, and the power of a damn good song. So grab your headphones, tune in, and get ready to join the farewell party of the century!

Warning: This podcast contains excessive amounts of laughter, friendship overload, and strong emotions. Side effects may include nostalgia, FOMO (fear of missing out), and an overwhelming desire to gather your own crew for a spontaneous road trip.

From pop anthems to soulful ballads, rock 'n' roll legends to emerging talents, we've got your musical cravings covered. With insightful analysis, lively banter, and a shared love for all things tuneful, "Tune Talk" is your ticket to an auditory adventure. So, grab your headphones, tune in, and get ready to join the conversation that celebrates the power of music. Let's talk tunes like never before on "Tune Talk"!

title: Ross Goes North: Musicians of Scotland
description:
Welcome to "Ross Goes North: Musicians of Scotland", a captivating and insightful podcast, a mini 'podcast EP' if you will, that takes you on a melodic journey through the diverse musical landscape of today's Scotland. Join us as we sit down with four extraordinary musicians from various genres, some habituated, some green, all hailing from the picturesque highlands.

In each episode, our host, Ross Ferguson, a passionate music enthusiast with Scottish roots himself, will engage in intimate and insightful conversations with these talented artists. Discover their unique stories, inspirations, and the essence of their Scottish musical roots that resonate through their captivating live performances.

title: Piano Kitchen Sessions Mixed and Compiled by Fuego
description:
Welcome Piano Kitchen Sessions Mixed and Compiled by Fuego," a mixtape dedicated to the emerging artist who's setting the Amapiano scene ablaze. Fuego, a talented producer and DJ, brings the heat with infectious beats and soulful melodies. Get ready to groove to his signature sound and exclusives from other artists around the genre of amapiano.

Piano Kitchen Sessions has taken us on a musical adventure through the world of Amapiano. This emerging artist has proven his talent as a producer and DJ, leaving a fiery mark on the genre. Keep an eye out for Fuego as he continues to rise and set the dance floors ablaze with his scorching beats and infectious tunes.

title: T'Nime Përnime (URBAN FM)
description: “T ‘nime Përnime” eksploron në thellësi proceset e krijimtarisë muzikore, prej muzikës klasike, asaj folklorike, nëpërmjet rock and rollit e muzikës pop, e deri te hip-hopi e elektronika. Muzikanti Arbër Salihu gjithashtu i njohur si La Fazani, ka me analizu dhe shtjellu kompozime, tekste, aranzhmane dhe produksione të ndryshme përgjatë shumë dekadave që përfshijnë stile të larmishme muzikore. Përveç se analizohet aspekti muzikor e artistik i albumeve, duke përfshirë produksionin, kompozimet, performanca, kopertina, kurimi etj, gjithashtu studiohet impakti shoqëror që këto albume kanë pasur në kohën që janë lansuar. Para se te filloj emisioni, duhet të lëshohet albumi për të cilin po flitet në tërësi. T’nime pernime me Arber Salihu çdo të merkure nga ora 21:00 deri në 22:00 në 103.5 dhe 105.5 FM Web: radiourban.fm

title: Ross Meets: The OMG Years
description:
Welcome to "Ross Meets: The OMG Years, a podcast that documents, discovers and celebrates the next generation of music artists, whilst exploring the history of seasoned talents. Each interview included in this podcast, takes listeners on a journey into the lives and music of each musician. Some are more experienced whereas some are brand new to the industry.

Ross has carefully selected a diverse range of musicians spanning various genres, that leapt out to him as soon as he saw/heard them for the first time. There is tons of candid conversation here, documented through the host, Ross Ferguson's time at Staffordshire university's student radio station, OMG Radio. Listeners gain a unique glimpse into the personal and artistic journeys of both the artist on display and Ross himself, who prides himself on natural, fun and insightful interviews to delve into each artists background, inspirations, creative processes, and hopes for the future.

title: #ARTSTAYSHERE's Culture Crisis Conversations
description:
Culture Crisis Conversations is the new podcast series from the #ARTSTAYSHERE Coalition. We talk with those who are impacted most by arts/music/cultural displacement, including artists, musicians, advocates, operators, developers, government, policy-makers, planners, funders & more--and discuss the causes & potential solutions.

#ARTSTAYSHERE is a volunteer-run, non-profit advocacy effort to prevent arts/music/cultural displacement across Greater Boston. Sign our online petition, sign up for email updates, and learn more at www.artstayshere.org.

In partnership with New Alliance East, New Alliance Audio & The Record Co.
